items.name: Big Family Planting in Las Rozas 2024

fields.event-name: Big Family Planting in Las Rozas 2024
fields.event_details:
The first open event of the European Tree Planting Day was a massive success! Around 1200 people participated not only in the ecological restoration of the area, but could also enjoy the cultural shows and environmental workshops that were held by the Las Rozas City Hall.

Our fourth year of collaboration in a row, and making it more successfull and unique every time! Thanks to all participants and the Las Rozas municipality for the amazing job!
fields.subscription_instructions: People can join freely by attending the event during the designated hours. It starts at 10:00am and lasts for around 5 hours. Find more information in the Las Rozas Municipality webpage: https://www.lasrozas.es/node/10799

items.name: H√©licon reforesta el parque Adolfo Su√°rez Valdemoro

fields.event-name: H√©licon reforesta el parque Adolfo Su√°rez Valdemoro
fields.event_details:
El pasado 13 de diciembre, en un esfuerzo por fomentar la conciencia ambiental y la participaci√≥n comunitaria, Ecoescuela H√©licon llev√≥ a cabo una plantaci√≥n de √°rboles en el parque Adolfo Su√°rez de Valdemoro. Este evento no solo ha sido una oportunidad para embellecer nuestro entorno, sino tambi√©n para involucrar a los estudiantes en acciones concretas contra la crisis clim√°tica.

La actividad ha sido posible gracias a la colaboraci√≥n del Ayuntamiento de Valdemoro, que ha facilitado una zona del parque y ha proporcionado veinte √°rboles, entre encinas y pinos carrascos. Esta colaboraci√≥n es un bonito ejemplo del trabajo conjunto entre instituciones para promover la educaci√≥n ambiental.

La plantaci√≥n se enmarca dentro del Proyecto Europeo Life Terra, en colaboraci√≥n con ADEAC (Asociaci√≥n de Educaci√≥n Medioambiental y del Consumidor), que es responsable en Espa√±a de los programas internacionales de la Foundation for Environmental Education (FEE).

En el acto participaron los ecodelegados del Comit√© Ambiental, quienes representaron a cada uno de los cursos de la ESO y Bachillerato, junto con un grupo de alumnos de Primaria de los niveles de 4¬∫ a 6¬∫, (en total 60 alumnos), y fueron acompa√±ados por 6 profesores.

Adem√°s, se cont√≥ con la presencia del Alcalde, el Concejal de Medio Ambiente y el responsable de Parques y Jardines de Valdemoro, lo que tambi√©n subraya la importancia de la colaboraci√≥n entre la educaci√≥n y la administraci√≥n local.

Este importante acontecimiento ha servido tambi√©n para marcar el inicio de una nueva andadura para Ecoescuela H√©licon, cuyo hilo conductor a lo largo de este curso ser√° LOS BOSQUES aline√°ndose con el ODS 15 "Vida en los ecosistemas terrestres", dedicado a promover el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas terrestres, luchar contra la desertificaci√≥n, detener e invertir la degradaci√≥n de las tierras y frenar la p√©rdida de la diversidad biol√≥gica.

Esta jornada no solo fue una lecci√≥n sobre el medio ambiente, sino tambi√©n una experiencia que uni√≥ a los alumnos de distintas edades y les ense√±√≥ el valor del trabajo en equipo. Sin duda un d√≠a memorable que quedar√° grabado en sus corazones y que les inspirar√° a seguir cuidando nuestro planeta.

Queremos agradecer a todos los que han hecho posible este evento y a quienes se sumen a esta noble causa. ¬°Juntos podemos hacer la diferencia!

items.name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mari√´nwaerdt

fields.event-name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mari√´nwaerdt
fields.event_details: Squally rain and loads of mud didn't stop ABN Amro, plus teams from Life Terra and Land Life Company. from planting [500?] trees at the Mari√´nwaerdt estate at the end of November! The challenging conditions brought out the best in everyone, and the volume of mud was often hilarious. Nobody went home clean, but they did go home happy, refreshed and satisfied by a bracing day of tree planting and the renewal of woodland devastated by Ash Dieback. Congratulations and thank you, ABN Amro!

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Kleverland

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Kleverland
fields.event_details: Het Kleverland is an agro-ecological, regenerative food garden located in the Netherlands. The initiative focuses on sustainable farming practices aimed at restoring the land's ecosystem while producing food. For further details, visit their website directly. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On December 1, 2024, a planting day was organized to plant several trees and fruit trees.

In December 2024, Zwaluweveld participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting around 300 small trees and shrubs. A planting event was held on December 7 and 8, 2024, inviting community members to contribute to the establishment of the food forest.

items.name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mari√´nwaerdt

fields.event-name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mari√´nwaerdt
fields.event_details:
On a crisp November morning under a bright sun, members of Tulpenrallye joined the Life Terra team in the field to plant trees at Mari√´nwaerdt estate. In the days up to the planting event it had rained heavily, so the participants had to deal with a muddy field with large puddles of water and ice and hardened soil here and there. They weren‚Äôt phased by these tough conditions and managed to plant around 250 trees! Thank you members of Tulpenrallye, for this amazing effort that helps this part of the Mari√´nwaerdt estate recover from Ash Dieback disease.

Tulpenrallye, organiser of the Dutch annual car rally event of the same name, is planting a total of 3,500 trees in partnership with Life Terra, to offset all CO2 emissions from the 70th edition.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Ecodorp land van aine

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Ecodorp land van aine
fields.event_details:
Ecodorp Land van Aine is an ecovillage project located in Ter Apel, Netherlands, dedicated to transforming a neglected industrial site into a sustainable community featuring vegetable gardens, herb gardens, a food forest, small-scale enterprises, and approximately 30 to 50 eco-friendly homes. In November 2024, Ecodorp Land van Aine participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for establishing food forests on their grounds, particularly around their camping areas and ponds.

A planting event was organized on Saturday, November 16, 2024, where participants planted various fruit trees and berry bushes and received information on creating and maintaining a food forest.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Benthuizen

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Benthuizen
fields.event_details:
In November 2024, Voedselbos Benthuizen participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting additional trees and shrubs. With community support, a planting day was held on November 29, 2024, inviting people to contribute to the growth and development of the food forest.

The food forest serves as a source of inspiration, demonstrating that nature and agriculture can go hand in hand while helping restore biodiversity and supporting pollinators.

items.name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY

fields.event-name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY
fields.event_details: Two teams from EY joined us on one day in late November at the Mari√´nwaerdt Estate to replant a forest that had been destroyed by Ash Dieback disease. In contrast to the week of rain preceding it, the day dawned bright and clear and it was a pleasure to be out in nature, in winter sunshine, backdropped by birdsong. The EY teams together planted [1000?] young trees, which are now standing in neat rows where previously just stumps and scrub existed. In just a few years, these will mature into an enchanting and hardy mixed woodland, bursting with biodiversity. Thank you EY and we look forward to planting with you again soon!

items.name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!

fields.event-name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!
fields.event_details:
Today, our two classes of 5-year-old students arrived at the designated planting area near the entrance of our school, so we expect them to show their parents and show them their tree.

They were thrilled to see our gardener, Juanma, prepared with the trees, soil, gloves, shovels, watering cans, and everything needed for the planting activity.

Once there, we asked the children why trees are so important and what they need to live. A variety of enthusiastic answers emerged: ‚ÄúThey need water,‚Äù ‚ÄúThey give us fruit‚Äù, ‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt like plastic,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThey clean the air.‚Äù

After this discussion, all the students helped Juanma by adding soil around the trees and stamping the ground to keep it firm. Some even picked up bits of litter they found nearby, proudly declaring that the trees wouldn‚Äôt like that. It was a wonderful day of learning and teamwork, and we can‚Äôt wait to watch our trees grow!

What a day to remember! Life Terra hosted our first tree-planting event with NVIDIA near Munich! They support this plot with 1,000 new trees ‚Äî a big thank you to NVIDIA for taking steps towards climate action and a greener future. Together we planted 200 trees and set up proper protectors around them.

Thanks to a fantastic fundraising campaign, NVIDIANs joined us for an incredible day in the forest, combining nature, teamwork, and a dose of wellbeing. From boosting mental health to building stronger connections with colleagues, this event truly had it all.

Welcome, NVIDIA, to the Life Terra family as our newest business supporter for climate action! Let‚Äôs keep growing together.

items.name: Kicking off the planting season in Limburg with BLG!

fields.event-name: Kicking off the planting season in Limburg with BLG!
fields.event_details:
During our first event at the Unesco World Heritage location of De Maasheggen, we planted around 700 trees with our partner BLG. Despite the snow, the participants were able to plant a beautiful new hedge that will contribute to this unique and biodiverse ecosystem.

This project close to the village of Oeffelt was organised by Maasheggen Mooi. This is an initiative by Lars van Peij, who has sadly been diagnosed with Huntington disease. He is therefore trying to plant as many new hedges as possible, to have a positive legacy for his son and the area he will grow up in.

We are very happy to be able to support this amazing effort. Please check out Maasheggen Mooi to help Lars with this beautiful initaitive. We also want to thank BLG for all their efforts during this lovely tree planting event.

items.name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha

fields.event-name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha
fields.event_details:
The Santa Clara a Velha Ecological Restoration project is Life Terra's biggest project in Portugal, with more than 65 ha restored using 7 different species.

This project aims to restore a former exhausted eucalyptus monoculture and transform the land into a biodiverse food forest. This will allow for soil recovery, natural regeneration, defragmentation of the habitat, and it will also produce fruit and pine nuts for the landowner as a form of revenue.

Furthermore, this project is certified for carbon removal and biodiversity credits, and this winter's plantation aimed to plant 7.500 plants as a way to make up for the mortality of the previous years.

This area suffers from intense droughts in summer, and the previous exhausted soils and the presence of wild boars makes the planting of new saplings in the first years a necessity in order to achieve our restoration goal. This shows that Life Terra's commitment to ecological restoration is a long-term view.

items.name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude

fields.event-name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude
fields.event_details: Chilly Dutch weather didn't deter a strong, hardy group of mariners and ship engineers during Reederei Nord's woven hedge planting event in Abcoude on 11th December! The group made swift progress along a 600m stretch of farmland, and soon the beginnings of the hedge were clear to see. We can't wait to see - and to share - how this hedge evolves to become a haven for local biodiversity, as well as a delicious source of fresh berries for local ramblers!

Our group helped the local nature association to plant this hedge in an agricultural area where biodiversity is usually very low. Children, adults, parents, friends and elderly people joined forces and planted these shrubs with a lot of fun and in record time!

La actividad finalmente fue muy, pero que muy bien. Al comienzo tuvimos algunos problemas log√≠siticos, como falta de herramientas, o que el ayuntamiento nos llev√≥ albarrobos en lugar de encinas. Por tanto, las especies que etiquetamos como "desconocidas" son todas algarrobo. Esperamos poder arreglarlo posteriormente.

Operarios del servicio de jardiner√≠a nos llevaron a media ma√±ana m√°s herramientas para poder avanzar m√°s r√°pido y al d√≠a siguiente fueron a poner puntos de goteo a todos los √°rboles plantados.

Por otro lado, los alumnos/as que parec√≠an desmotivados se vinieron arriba y no hab√≠a quien los parara (algunos no quer√≠an parar para desayunar) y siguieron plantando hasta el √∫ltimo segundo.

La zona en la que hemos hecho la reforestaci√≥n era una antigua escombrera, transformada en zona verde del pueblo, junto a un ermita. En varias ocasiones desde el ayuntamiento han intentado ajardinar esa zona sin mucho √©xito. Tras el an√°lisis que hicimos desde el centro vimos que uno de los principales problemas era la densidad de conejo de campo en esa zona, por lo que decidimos poner protectores met√°licos a todos los √°rboles.

Algunas propuestas de mejora son una mejor coordinaci√≥n con la concejal√≠a de jardines para el pr√©stamo de herramientas, poder etiquetar plantas en la app con su nombre aunque no estuvieran en la lista prevista, y enterrar mejor los protectores met√°licos que pusimos (ya que quedaron un poco endebles).

Queremos hacer un v√≠deo-resumen de la actividad pero por ahora no hemos tenido tiempo, te paso el enlace a la carpeta con fotos y v√≠deos del evento. https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tbn_BEKh4HFryLa_Gh29h7OkFgBmC6_P?usp=sharing

Si hay publicaci√≥n agradecer√≠amos que se etiquete al Ayuntamiento de √Åguilas y al IES Europa.

Muchas gracias

items.name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas

fields.event-name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas
fields.event_details:
On Thursday 21 November, Cascos Verdes (Green Helmets) and employees from Amazon and Amazon Web Services gathered in Las Rozas, Madrid, to plant 150 trees and shrubs to restore the Dehesa de Navalcarb√≥n.

The planting took place alongside a local school, Colegio Zola, where employees and students learned not only about planting but also about local species and the importance of caring for the environment.

The Green Helmets initiative aims to reforest and carry out work to improve the forest environment after the 2021 fires in Andalusia, south of Spain. Now, they are also expanding their reforestation efforts across the country.

We enjoyed the enthusiasm and energy of the Amazon employees, who, divided into groups, did amazing work hand in hand with the students.

At the end of the activity, and because we still had some time left, participants also learned about an insect hotel that is placed next to the planting site, which will help to attract pollinators and foster a healthier ecosystem around it.

We hope this will be the first of many collaborations!

fields.event_details:
Het Groente Genootschap is a self-harvest garden located in Netherlands. It offers members the opportunity to weekly harvest local vegetables, herbs, and small fruits cultivated according to biological and ecological principles. The initiative emphasizes enhancing biodiversity, soil health, and fostering a strong local community.

In November 2024, Het Groente Genootschap participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, aiming to raise funds for planting a biodiverse hedge, additional fruit trees and shrubs, and initiating a potential future food forest. The planting event took place on November 26, 2024.

items.name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld

fields.event-name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld
fields.event_details:
The planting activity at The Green Rebel farm in Miravet was an inspiring and hands-on experience for everyone involved. Over the five-day event, 24 students from College Hageveld, accompanied by three teachers, planted 200 trees in Hageveld‚Äôs Foodforest, continuing their tradition of planting one tree for each graduating student. The students worked enthusiastically, learning about regenerative agroforestry practices while preparing the soil with biochar, sowing fava beans, and adding mulch and cover crops to ensure the trees thrive in the challenging Mediterranean conditions.

The atmosphere was vibrant, with students enjoying the process of planting and gaining a deeper understanding of how these actions contribute to combating climate change. The weather was cooperative, with sunny days making the work enjoyable. In addition to planting, the group bonded over shared meals they prepared with fresh produce harvested from the farm, creating a strong connection to the land and to each other. This event not only added 200 more trees to the food forest but also planted seeds of awareness and hope in the minds of young people, empowering them to take action for a sustainable future.

The new Avenue of Freedom was established on Saturday, November 9th, in the Broumov region, where persecution of clergy from all over Czechoslovakia was concentrated during the previous communist regime. In the 1950s, an internment camp for priests and monks from various orders was set up in the local Benedictine monastery. By planting the Avenue of Freedom, we commemorated the past and expressed our respect for those who suffered and fought for our freedom.

The event is organized within the project ‚ÄûPlanting Our Future‚Äù, supported by the International Visegrad Fund. Its aim is to exchange knowledge and experience in the field of tree planting and tree care programs in Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovakia.

En una inspiradora jornada de acci√≥n clim√°tica, los alumnos de 6¬∫ de Primaria del Colegio Casvi Boadilla participaron activamente en el European Tree Planting Day. Utilizando aplicaciones como Pl@ntNet y consultando herramientas digitales como ARCGIS, seleccionaron cuidadosamente √°rboles adaptados al clima local evitando especies invasoras y considerando aquellas en peligro de extinci√≥n.

La actividad comenz√≥ con din√°micas grupales que motivaron a los alumnos a reflexionar sobre el cambio clim√°tico y c√≥mo sus acciones pueden contribuir al cuidado del medio ambiente. Tras la explicaci√≥n te√≥rica y demostraci√≥n pr√°ctica realizada por los docentes, los estudiantes se dividieron en grupos peque√±os para llevar a cabo la plantaci√≥n. Echten - With a push of the green button, Albert Verlinde (chairman of the National Tree Planting Day Foundation), Inge Nieuwenhuizen (mayor of the municipality of De Wolden) and Sylvo Thijsen (director of Staatsbosbeheer) opened the 67th National Tree Planting Day today at Staatsbosbeheer-forest ranger's office Ruinen in Echten . During this green holiday, thousands of pupils throughout the Netherlands left their classrooms and went into their residential areas or nature to plant trees.

Donn√© Slangen, Director-General of Nature and Fisheries of the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries, Food Security and Nature confirmed later that day the importance of nature education for all children. Together with a number of children, he planted a tree in the Ruinen forestry in the municipality of De Wolden (Drenthe). In doing so, he and all the other planters became, according to columnist Marcel van Ool, advisor on landscape and cultural history of Staatsbosbeheer, 'part of a miracle'.

Quinta da Penha Longa is a property close to Sintra and Cascais, well known for its natural and built heritage, but also for including the Caesar Park Penha Longa Golf Resort Hotel and a set of residential areas. On the forest area of Quinta da Penha Longa, Caesar Park is developing an ambitious program of rewilding and control of invasive species. In 2023, Life Terra had the opportunity to organize, together with Caesar Park, a planting event associated with this program.

The idea that citizens should be involved in rewilding processes is the central idea of the Life Terra project. This is also the central idea of the event to be held on December 10th at Quinta da Penha Longa, where residents together with the company's employees will, once again, participate directly in the planting operations of native species included in the rewilding program. This event will have the support of Cascais Ambiente, the environment agency of the Cascais municipality

The Caesar Park‚Äôs transformative idea that the natural value of the forest space is an important dimension of the resort's quality, justifying relevant investments in its conservation, is also strongly associated with Life Terra's objectives and action in multiple areas in Europe.

After the incredible success of our tree-planting last year, in which we tagged over a thousand agroforestry trees that have survived and thrived, we did a small tree-planting this year to be eligible to participate in the ‚ÄúTree Planting Day‚Äù and to demonstrate the very best of our tree-planting techniques.

We created a photo gallery of 10 innovative and fun, science based, micro-techniques we use when planting, to give the trees a fantastic chance of living and producing, without irrigation, on the borders of our vineyard.

These are the ten techniques we share with you:

1) Choose your spot: Within the planned area we chose a spot under a deep layer of natural mulch where the soil remains humid for longer

2) Biochar: We add a small shovel of activated biochar in the hole to increase microbiology and it acts like a sponge retaining water and nutrients.

3) High quality compost: We mis the natural soil with some high quality organic cow manure and mushroom substrate compost from ‚ÄúMyceliOrganic‚Äù

4) Smart watering: ‚Öî of the water is added to the bottom of the hole, while the tree is loosely in place

5) Add a worm: We added one to each tree!

6) Donut: A small circular ditch at the drip line helps water infiltrate where the roots need it most

7) Compost Tea: We mixed a about 20ml of compost tea with the remaining 2 litres of water for the final watering

8) Cone: This takes the water away from the trunk to encourage roots to grow outwards and be more wind resistant.

9) Seeds: We add perennial cover crop seeds around the tree to create a syntropic relationship.

10) Mulch: We add a light mulch which lets the seeds grow, but keeps direct sun off the soil.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Tweede Adem

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Tweede Adem
fields.event_details: "Een Tweede Adem" is a therapeutic food forest initiative in Sint-Denijs, Zwevegem, Belgium. It aims to create a green space where individuals can connect with nature, enhancing well-being and fostering a sense of community. In December 2024, the project participated in Treevember, organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for developing the food forest. A planting event was held on December 7, where volunteers planted more than 750 trees and plants contributing to biodiversity.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Boskruit

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Boskruit
fields.event_details:
Boskruit is the first public and collectively managed food forest in Antwerp. In November 2024, Boskruit participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for further development.

A planting day was held on Sunday, November 17, 2024, inviting community members to participate in transforming the area into a thriving forest ecosystem.

items.name: Pollinators Treevember event in Voedselbos Sloterpark

fields.event-name: Pollinators Treevember event in Voedselbos Sloterpark
fields.event_details: Voedselbos Sloterpark is a community-driven initiative dedicated to creating a sustainable food forest that benefits both people and wildlife. Participating in Treevember, an event organized by The Pollinators, the project aims to raise funds for various enhancements. On November 16 Voedselbos Sloterpark hosted a planting event at Natuurkamer Sloterpark, located in Amsterdam. Community members were invited to participate in planting new trees and shrubs, fostering growth and biodiversity in the food forest.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Vrij Leven Rijsbergen

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Vrij Leven Rijsbergen
fields.event_details:
Voedselbos Vrij Leven is a 1.4-hectare food forest located in the Netherlands, dedicated to promoting self-sufficient living and fostering a deep connection between people and nature.

In November 2024, Voedselbos Vrij Leven participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for the further development of their food forest.

On Saturday, November 30, 2024, they organized a volunteer day where participants helped plant trees, care for animals, and enjoyed freshly made pizzas from their clay oven. The event aimed to connect people with nature and educate both young and old about the environment.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Berk & Boom

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Berk & Boom
fields.event_details: Voedselbos Berk&Boom is a community-driven project located in the Netherlands. The initiative aims to enhance the local ecosystem. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for additional developments. A planting event was held on November 22 and 23, 2024, inviting the community to participate.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Batonia Beekenbos

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Batonia Beekenbos
fields.event_details: Batonia Beekenbos is a community food forest. Their plan is to produce fresh, delicious and healthy food for approximately 40 households that come to harvest themselves and a number of restaurants in the area. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. In November and early December planting activities were held almost every weekend and occasionally during the week.

De Avonturentuin participated in the Treevember campaign by raising funds to create a food forest on their property. The initiative aims to plant 50 trees and shrubs, providing food, biodiversity, and shelter for people, animals, and pollinators. It supports sustainability and community health.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at De grune grond

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at De grune grond
fields.event_details: In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. During the initiative, an event was organized to plant trees, expand the food forest and increase its biodiversity.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst
fields.event_details: Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst is a community-driven project transforming a field into a 1.1-hectare food forest. In November 2024, Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting over 100 trees and shrubs, including quince, apple, nashi pear, elderberry, and medlar. Funds were also used to purchase materials to give the plants a good start, such as wood chips. A nursery was also set up next to the food forest to propagate plants in the future.

items.name: Treevember event at Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland

fields.event-name: Treevember event at Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland
fields.event_details: Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland is a half-hectare food forest project located in the Netherlands. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On November 30, 2024, a planting day was organized where volunteers planted fruit trees, berry bushes, and began preparations for the pond. The event fostered community engagement and hands-on learning about sustainable practices.

fields.event_details:
El mi√©rcoles 15 de Enero disfrutamos de una preciosa jornada de plantaci√≥n organizada por la Fundaci√≥n Montescola y ayudados por los estudiantes del Colegio Jaime Balmes de Noia.

Aprovechando el buen tiempo, logramos plantar m√°s de 100 ejemplares de olmo resistente a la grafiosis, contribuyendo a los esfuerzos de restauraci√≥n que la Fundaci√≥n Montescola y la aldea de Frox√°n llevan realizando para recuperar el bosque aut√≥ctono de frondosas en una parcela antiguamente invadida por Pino de Monterrey.

¬°Gracias a todos los que hicieron posible esta iniciativa!

For our first event of 2025 twenty-five enthuastic students from the school were joined by eight adult volunteers in the winter sunshine to plant 475 native trees and shrubs. Although some surface weeds had rooted in the mulch the soil beneath was relatively warm with lots of worms near the surface. The transition year (TY) students worked really hard and we completed that task in almost record time. Following the event we were treated to tea/coffee and sandwiches. Another Stepping Stone Forest, and the first in 2025 was successfully planted.

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos De Godin
fields.event_details: De Godin, Eetbaar Landschap is a 4,000 m¬≤ food forest project in the Netherlands, dedicated to creating a space for community engagement, collaboration, and discovery. In November 2024, De Godin participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting. A planting event was scheduled for December 1, 2024, from 13:00 to 16:00, inviting community members to join in the planting activities. Participants were offered coffee, tea, and refreshments during the event.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at 't Volle Bos

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at 't Volle Bos
fields.event_details: t Volle Bos, a small food forest edge in the Netherlands. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On November 23, 2024, a planting day was organized to plant fruit trees, shurubs and herbs to expand the food forest and increase it biodiversity and resilience.
